question: Which of the following is a fundamental unit?
A car moving with a speed of 90kmh-1 was brought uniformly to rest by the application of the brakes in 10s. How far did the car travel after the brakes were applied?
explanation:
speed = \(\frac{90 \times 10^3}{3600}\) = 25ms-1

Acceleration = velocity change / time = 25 / 10

: Acceleration = 2.5

Using S = Ut + \(\frac{1}{2}\) at^2

S =  \(\frac{1}{2}\) X 2.5 X 10^2 = 125m

Which of the following statements are correct about an object in equilibrium under parallel forces? i. the total clockwise moments of the forces about any point equals the total anti-clockwise moments about the same point. ii. the total forces in one direction equals the total forces in the opposite direction. iii. the resolved components along the x-axis equals the resolved components along the y-axis.

A body of mass 10kg rests on a rough inclined plane whose angle of tilt \(\theta\) is variable. \(\theta\) is gradually increased until the body starts to slide down the plane at 30<sup>o</sup>. The coefficient of limiting friction between the body and the plane
An inclined plane which makes an angle of 30<sup>o</sup>with the horizontal has a velocity ratio of

What is the length of liquid column in a barometer tube that would support an atmospheric pressure of 102000Nm<sup>-2</sup>if the density of the liquid is 2600kgm<sup>-3</sup>? [g = 10ms<sup>-2</sup>]
explanation:
pressure = g x density x height

102000 = 10 x 2600 x height

height = 3.92m

question: 40m<sup>3</sup>of liquid is mixed with 60m<sup>3</sup>of another liquid Q. If the density of P and Q are 1.00kgm<sup>-3</sup>and 1.6kgm<sup>-3</sup>respectively, what is the density of the mixture?
explanation:
Mp= 1 x 40 = 40kg ; mQ = 1.6 x 60 = 96kg

volume of mixture = 40 + 60 = 100m3

mass of mixture = 40 + 96 = 136kg

density of mixture = \(\frac{136}{100}\)

= 1.36kgm3

question: The resistances of platinum wire at the ice and steam points are 0.75 ohm and 1.05 ohm respectively. Determine the temperature at which the resistance of the wire is 0.90 ohm

The pressure of a gas when cooled at constant volume will decrease because the molecules
options: collide less frequently with the walls of the container
have the same average kinetic energy

question: 1kg of copper is transferred quickly from boiling water to a block of ice. Calculate the mass of ice melted, neglecting heat loss. [specific heat capacity of copper 400Jkg<sup>-1</sup>K<sup>-1</sup>and latent heat of fusion of ice 333 x 10<sup>3</sup>Jkg<sup>-1</sup>]
explanation:
Heat lost = heat gained

1 x 400 x (100 - 0) = m x 333000

m = 0.12kg

converting to grams; 0.12 x 1000

= 120g

question: Which of the following conditions will make water boil at a temperature of 100<sup>o</sup>C when the atmospheric pressure is 750mmHg?
options: heat more rapidly at the same pressure
reduce the external pressure by a quarter

question: Which of the following statements? i. land and sea breezes are natural convection currents. ii. convection may occur in liquids or gasses but not in solids. iii. the vacuum in a thermos flask prevents heat loss due to convection only.

A light wave of frequency 5 x 10<sup>14</sup>Hz moves through water which has a refractive index of \(\frac{4}{3}\). Calculate the wavelength in water if the velocity of light in air is 3 x 10<sup>8</sup>ms<sup>-1</sup>
A wave disturbance travelling in air enters a medium in which its velocity is less than that in air. Which of the following statements is true about the wave medium?
options: both the frequency of the wave and the wavelength are decreased
the frequency of the wave is decreased while the wavelength is increased
the frequency of the wave is unaltered while the wavelength is decreased
the frequency of the wave is decreased while the wavelength is unaltered

question: When light is incident on an object which is magenta in colour, which of the following colour would be absorbed?

In a resonance tube experiment, the effective length of the air column for the first resonance is 20cm when set into vibration by a tuning fork of frequency 480Hz. Neglecting and effect, the velocity of sound in air is
explanation:
\(\lambda\) = 4(L + C) ; where C = o

\(\lambda\) = 4 x 20 = 80cm

V = \(\lambda\)F

= 80 x 10-2x 480 = 384ms-1

question: An organic pipe closed at one end is 80cm long. Determine the frequency of the fundamental note assuming that the speed of sound in air is 340ms-1
explanation:
\(\lambda\) = 4L

= 4 x 80 = 320cm

Converting 320cm to m, we have 3.2m

F = \(\frac{V}{\lambda}\)

= \(\frac{340}{3.2}\)

= 106.25Hz

\(\approxeq\) 106Hz
